answerText: Ursa Majoris[10] W Ursae Majoris is a prototypical example of this class of binary stars that exhibit variability. Most members of this class of binary stars exhibit a characteristic two valley light curve and share the Earth's plane of orbit.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 15 | 4 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Containing Alkaid, Mizar, Aloth, Megrez, Phecda, Merak, and Dubhe, the Big Dipper is one of the most well-known asterisms in the sky. For 10 points each: [10] Name the constellation in which the Big Dipper is located. It is the larger of two constellations which depict bears in the Northern Hemisphere.
